name: ASSIST v3.0
full_name: Alcohol, Smoking and Substance Involvement Screening Test v3.0
summary: WHO-developed screening test for substance use across 10 substance categories with standardized risk assessment.
description: The ASSIST v3.0 is a WHO-validated screening tool that assesses substance use involvement and provides risk-based intervention recommendations across tobacco, alcohol, cannabis, cocaine, amphetamines, inhalants, sedatives, hallucinogens, opioids, and other substances.

clinical_interpretations.Low Risk: You are at low risk of health and other problems from your current pattern of use. Brief advice about lower-risk use and routine monitoring during health visits is appropriate.
clinical_interpretations.Moderate Risk: You are at risk of health and other problems from your current pattern of substance use. Brief intervention including structured advice, self-help materials, and follow-up within 1-3 months is recommended. Specialist referral may be considered if brief intervention is unsuccessful or multiple substances are involved.
clinical_interpretations.High Risk: You are at high risk of experiencing severe problems (health, social, financial, legal, relationship) as a result of your current pattern of use and are likely to be dependent. Further assessment and more intensive treatment including specialist drug and alcohol treatment services is recommended.
clinical_interpretations.Injection Drug Use: History of injection drug use significantly increases health risks including blood-borne viruses (HIV, Hepatitis B/C), collapsed veins, abscesses, and overdose. Immediate specialist referral for comprehensive assessment, harm reduction strategies, and treatment planning is strongly recommended.

sections.title: About the ASSIST v3.0
sections.text: The WHO Alcohol, Smoking and Substance Involvement Screening Test (ASSIST) v3.0 is a validated screening instrument that identifies substance use risk across 10 categories. It provides specific risk levels and intervention recommendations based on standardized WHO criteria and has been validated in multiple countries and healthcare settings.

sections.title: Instructions
sections.text: Please answer each question honestly based on your substance use experiences. For prescription medications, only consider non-medical use (taking more than prescribed, using without a prescription, or using for non-medical reasons). All responses are confidential and will help determine appropriate next steps for your health and wellbeing.

sections.title: Scoring and Interpretation
sections.text: The ASSIST calculates separate involvement scores for each substance category by adding scores from questions 2-7 (excluding tobacco question 5). Risk levels are determined by specific thresholds: tobacco and illicit substances use 0-3/4-26/27+ thresholds, while alcohol uses 0-10/11-26/27+ thresholds reflecting its legal status and different risk profile.
